title: ArianeGroup begins testing prototype of multirole Susie upper stage
summary: ArianeGroup has begun testing what it considers to be a versatile answer to numerous challenges facing European spaceflight.

title: DLR Successfully Tests its New Red Kite Solid Rocket Motor
summary:
The German space agency DLR completed the first flight test of its Red Kite solid rocket motor that will power European sounding rockets. Development of the Red Kite rocket motor began in 2019 as a joint project between DLR and Bayern-Chemie. Red Kite is a one-tonne class solid rocket motor that can be utilized in […]
The post DLR Successfully Tests its New Red Kite Solid Rocket Motor appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Daily Telescope: A snapshot of 500,000 stars near the center of the galaxy
summary: Webb reveals the Sagittarius C region of the Milky Way.

title: Starliner “on track” for April crewed test flight
summary: NASA says the first crewed launch of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner vehicle remains on schedule for the middle of April as the company completes work to resolve the latest technical problems with the vehicle.

title: NASA Mars smallsat mission to be on first New Glenn launch
summary: NASA expects that a Mars smallsat mission will be on the first launch of Blue Origin’s New Glenn launch vehicle within a year, although with some risk about whether the rocket will be ready in time.

title: McAlister: Space Station Gap Would Be “Not Great, But Not Irrecoverable”
summary: As the International Space Station celebrates its 25th anniversary, the Director of NASA’s Commercial Space Division said today that the agency is working closely with partners to avoid a space […]

title: Jupiter-3 deploys solar arrays and antennas in orbit
summary: the world’s heaviest commercial communications satellite, is performing as expected after deploying solar arrays and antennas in geostationary orbit.

title: Stars aligning for Boeing crew launch in April
summary: The long-awaited crewed launch of Starliner has gained increased positivity that its latest launch date will remain on target, following numerous slips since the maiden uncrewed flight to the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Battle of the Bands: What’s at stake for space at WRC-23
summary: The stage is set for a global showdown four years in the making for access to the radio waves needed for communications in space, on Earth, and everywhere in between.

title: MDA gets $131 million from mystery NGSO constellation customer
summary: An undisclosed customer is paying MDA 180 million Canadian dollars ($131 million) to start engineering a non-geostationary constellation of 36 satellites.
